attribs.name: repeating_feat-ancestry_-NNvva3XgWyCqCejFaHk_feat_ancestry_notes
attribs.current: You have learned to access the old magic of wild places. Choose one cantrip from the primal spell list. You can cast this cantrip as an innate primal spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-ancestry_-NNvva3XgWyCqCejFaHk_feat_ancestry_benefits
attribs.current: Cast Guidance as an innate primal spell at will

attribs.name: repeating_feat-bonus_-NNvwNMX5uXwqi0sgIgu_feat_bonus_notes
attribs.current: You cast spells like a magus, gaining a spellbook with four common arcane cantrips of your choice. You gain the Cast a Spell activity. You can prepare two cantrips each day from your spellbook. Each time you gain a spell slot of a new level from the magus archetype, add a spell of that level or lower to your spellbook. You're trained in arcane spell attack rolls and spell DCs. Your key spellcasting ability for magus archetype spells is Intelligence, and they are arcane magus spells. You become trained in Arcana; if you were already trained in Arcana, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You become trained in simple weapons.  [gained from heritage]

attribs.name: repeating_feat-bonus_-NNvwNMX5uXwqi0sgIgu_feat_bonus_benefits
attribs.current: Learn 4 arcane cantrips (Detect Magic, Read Aura, Mage Hand, Daze); prepare two each day

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NNvyeasE1Mb9zuycyR7_description
attribs.current:
You focus on the target object, opening your mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, you know whether that item is magical, and if it is, you learn the school of magic.

If the object is illusory, you detect this only if the effect's level is lower than the level of your read aura spell.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NNvznkIuaq7yGf56jNR_target
attribs.current: 1 unattended object of light Bulk or less

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NNvznkIuaq7yGf56jNR_description
attribs.current: You create a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because you're levitating the object, you can move it in any direction. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NNw-uITb9VyXwHNFKE3_description
attribs.current: You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also stunned 1.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NNw0Yvit49Bbl5Sm6ox_description
attribs.current: You ask for divine guidance, granting the target a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check the target attempts before the duration ends. The target chooses which roll to use the bonus on before rolling. If the target uses the bonus, the spell ends. Either way, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw1t3W6qhYrtBPZynH_benefit
attribs.current: You gain a status bonus of +5 feet to your speed.

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw1t3W6qhYrtBPZynH_description
attribs.current: Enzymatic compounds in this elixir strengthen and excite the muscles in your legs. You gain a status bonus to your Speed for the listed duration.

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw2U4HfD8H37M0ql7v_benefit
attribs.current: Gain a +1 item bonus to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks and all checks to Recall Knowledge.  Your critical failures on Recall Knowledge become failures instead.

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw2U4HfD8H37M0ql7v_drawback
attribs.current: You take a -2 penalty to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Athletics checks, and Acrobatics checks.  You can carry 2 less Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered, and the maximum Bulk you can carry is reduced by 4.

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw2U4HfD8H37M0ql7v_description
attribs.current:
Your mind becomes clear and cognition flows freely, but physical matters seem ephemeral. 

Gain a +1 item bonus to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks and all checks to Recall Knowledge.  Your critical failures on Recall Knowledge become failures instead.

You take a -2 penalty to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Athletics checks, and Acrobatics checks.  You can carry 2 less Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered, and the maximum Bulk you can carry is reduced by 4.

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw3Pj315-UccZ36HuY_benefit
attribs.current: Gain a +1 item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks.  Your critical failures with any of these skills become failures instead.

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw3Pj315-UccZ36HuY_drawback
attribs.current: You take a -2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks.  Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill.  All your failures to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw3Pj315-UccZ36HuY_description
attribs.current:
Gain a +1 item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks.  Your critical failures with any of these skills become failures instead.

You take a -2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks.  Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill.  All your failures to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw3ND85CJeJJ6rcmfG_benefit
attribs.current: You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks, Stealth checks, Thievery checks, Reflex saves, and Dexterity-based attack rolls, and you gain a +5 foot status bonus to your Speed.

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw3ND85CJeJJ6rcmfG_drawback
attribs.current: You take damage equal to twice your level; you can't recover Hit Points lost in this way by any means while the mutagen lasts. You take a 2 penalty to Fortitude saves

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw3ND85CJeJJ6rcmfG_description
attribs.current: Your features become thin and angular. You become swifter and nimbler, but your body also becomes fragile.

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw3FrosNTgWfITAq3S_benefit
attribs.current: For the next hour, you gain an +1 item bonus to Perception checks.  The bonus is +2 when attempting to find secret doors and traps.

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw3FrosNTgWfITAq3S_description
attribs.current: After you drink this elixir, you notice subtle visual details.

attribs.name: repeating_elixirs_-NNw3KSlUdapOfW9Z6lT_description
attribs.current: Regain 1d6 hit points.  Gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws against disease and poison for 10 minutes.

attribs.name: repeating_senses_-NNw6V1wDSjEMG3Ta3wg_sense_notes
attribs.current: You can see in dim light as though it were bright light, and you ignore the concealed condition due to dim light.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-bonus_-NNw97SHeYJrYHVAI3Ii_feat_bonus_notes
attribs.current: You can Identify Magic swiftly. You take only 1 minute when using Identify Magic to determine the properties of an item, ongoing effect, or location, rather than 10 minutes. If youre a master, it takes a 3-action activity, and if youre legendary, it takes 1 action.  [Gained from Background]

attribs.name: repeating_feat-bonus_-NNw97SHeYJrYHVAI3Ii_feat_bonus_prerequisites
attribs.current: trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNw9wMv7JrlrWBcuZWN_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: You can use the Craft activity to create alchemical items. When you select this feat, you immediately add the formulas for four common 1st-level alchemical items to your formula book.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNwAiuoJ1ltzmNZxnk1_feat_class_notes
attribs.current:
You spend 1 minute examining the details of one potential clue, designating the subject related to that clue as the target of your active investigation. This subject is typically a single creature, item, or small location (such as a room or corridor), but the GM might allow a different scope for your investigation. You don't need to know the identity, purpose, or nature of the subject, but you do need to be aware of its existence. For instance, finding a footprint is enough to investigate the creature that left it, and seeing a hasty sketch of an item or location can be enough to start your investigation of that subject.

Whenever you attempt a Perception or skill check to investigate a designated subject, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the check. The exact checks this applies to depend on the actions you use to investigate and are determined by the GM, but checks to investigate are typically Perception checks or skill checks that use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.

You can maintain two active investigations at a time. If you Pursue another Lead after that, the subject must be different from any of your current investigations (or rather, they must be different as far as you know), and you give up on a current subject of your choice. Once you've given up pursuit of a subject, you can't Pursue that Lead again until after the next time you make your daily preparations.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNwAiuoJ1ltzmNZxnk1_feat_class_benefits
attribs.current: +1 **circumstance bonus** on Perception or skill checks to investigate a subject of an investigation

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNwBEj79gpmWRTE3x9S_feat_class_trigger
attribs.current: Another creature attempts a check to investigate a lead you are pursuing

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNwBEj79gpmWRTE3x9S_feat_class_benefits
attribs.current: Grant the target a circumstance bonus to their skill check

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNwBEj79gpmWRTE3x9S_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: You share information with the triggering creature. They gain a circumstance bonus to their check equal to your circumstance bonus to checks investigating your subject from Pursue a Lead. The GM can add any relevant traits to this reaction depending on the situation, such as auditory and linguistic if you're conveying information verbally.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNwBapZCWVZIzptNewN_feat_class_notes
attribs.current:
You assess a foe's weaknesses in combat and use them to formulate a plan of attack against your enemy. Choose a creature you can see and roll a d20. If you Strike the chosen creature later this round, you must use the result of the roll you made to Devise a Stratagem for your Strike's attack roll instead of rolling. You make this substitution only for the first Strike you make against the creature this round, not any subsequent attacks.

When you make this substitution, you can also add your Intelligence modifier to your attack roll instead of your Strength or Dexterity modifier, provided your Strike uses an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, a ranged weapon (which must be agile or finesse if it's a melee weapon with the thrown trait), or a sap.

If you're aware that the creature you choose is the subject of a lead you're pursuing, you can use this ability as a free action.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNwBapZCWVZIzptNewN_feat_class_benefits
attribs.current: Preview an attack roll before acting; if the weapon is agile, finesse, or ranged, add Intelligence instead of Dexterity to the attack roll and trigger additional damage from Strategic Strike

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNwCVlh4tCCYwPYwUEu_feat_class_notes
attribs.current:
When you strike carefully and with forethought, you deal a telling blow. When making a Strike that adds your Intelligence modifier on your attack roll due to Devising a Stratagem, you deal an additional 1d6 precision damage.

As your investigator level increases, so too does the deadliness of your strategic strike. Increase the number of dice by one at 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th levels.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNwCrvn9Qi9BlyO5N8V_feat_class_requirements
attribs.current: You know the formula for the alchemical item your creating, you are holding or wearing alchemist's tools, and you have a free hand

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNwCrvn9Qi9BlyO5N8V_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: You quickly brew up a short-lived tincture. You create a single alchemical elixir or tool of your level or lower without having to spend the normal monetary cost in alchemical reagents or needing to attempt a Crafting check. This item has the infused trait, but it remains potent only until the end of the current turn.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNwDdrtczvO-q4ba4xI_feat_class_notes
attribs.current:
When you enter a new location, such as a room or corridor, you immediately notice one thing out of the ordinary. The GM determines what it is, or whether there's nothing reasonable to pick up, skipping obvious clues that can be easily noticed without a check or specifically looking for them. You learn only that an area or object is suspicious, but not why it's suspicious. For example, if you entered a study with a large bloodstain on the ground, the bloodstain is so obviously suspicious it's evident to you already, so the GM might note that there's something suspicious about the desk drawer instead. You would then need to investigate the drawer further to find out what specifically is out of the ordinary. That's Odd doesn't reveal whether creatures are suspicious.

You don't typically get any benefit when you leave and come back to a place, though if a major change has happened there and time has passed, the GM might determine that you do.

(*GMs should provide a character with the Thats Odd investigator feat a hint whenever the character enters a room with hidden aspects, specifically with regard to hidden passageways (such as scuff marks near a bookcase thats actually a swinging door), creatures or hazards (such as drippage on the floor from an unseen fungus growing on the rafters), or valuables (such as bunched carpet over a secret compartment in the floor that contains a bag of coins). The GM does not need to provide clues for rooms that have no significant secret or hidden features. These clues should indicate only that the character should investigate a given section of the room, not let them automatically uncover the hidden element or provide any additional information beyond signaling its presence.*)

attribs.name: repeating_languages_-NOvtRcYotMYGWjvUKLs_language_notes
attribs.current: fey, centaurs, plant and fungus creatures

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NNw-uITb9VyXwHNFKE3_save_success
attribs.current: The target takes half damage (round down).

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NNw-uITb9VyXwHNFKE3_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target takes full damage and is stunned 1.

attribs.name: repeating_ranged-strikes_-npvejoy7zphlz-cod2u_weapon_notes
attribs.current:
Volley 30 ft.:

This ranged weapon is less effective at close distances. Your attacks against targets that are at a distance within the range listed take a 2 penalty.

attribs.name: repeating_ranged-strikes_-npvejoy7zphlz-cod2u_weapon_critical_notes
attribs.current:
Deadly d10:

On a critical hit, the weapon adds a weapon damage die of the listed size. Roll this after doubling the weapon's damage. This increases to two dice if the weapon has a greater striking rune and three dice if the weapon has a major striking rune.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NUZWZu1R4TGSTBB7wBF_feat_class_trigger
attribs.current: Hit a creature with an attack on which you substituted your attack roll due to Devising a Stratagem

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NUZWZu1R4TGSTBB7wBF_feat_class_benefits
attribs.current: Designate one ally. The creature you hit is flat-footed to that ally on the next attack the designated ally makes against that creature before the start of your next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-skill_-NUZXcoI3t-lU9haxS7z_feat_skill_notes
attribs.current: Your study of magic allows you to instinctively sense its presence. You can cast 1st-level detect magic at will as an arcane innate spell. If youre a master in Arcana, the spell is heightened to 3rd level; if youre legendary, it is heightened to 4th level.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NUZYuo7f7pcWtOR179Z_duration
attribs.current: until the start of your next turn

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NUZYuo7f7pcWtOR179Z_description
attribs.current:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a **+1 circumstance bonus to AC** until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the Shield Block reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the magic missile spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

([Shield Block](https://2e.aonprd.com/Feats.aspx?ID=839)     reduces the damage taken by an amount equal to the shield's hardness)

attribs.name: repeating_feat-general_-NUZjntfbbL7ZYSKftZo_feat_general_notes
attribs.current:
You take your time searching to ensure you find everything. 

When Searching, you can take twice as long to search. Normally this means you Search at up to one quarter of your Speed, to a maximum of 150 feet per minute to check everything, or 75 feet per minute to check everything before you walk into it. If you do, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Perception checks to Seek.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-general_-NUZjntfbbL7ZYSKftZo_feat_general_benefits
attribs.current: **+2 circumstance bonus** to your Perception checks to Seek.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNwCVlh4tCCYwPYwUEu_feat_class_trigger
attribs.current: Make a Strike that added your Intelligence modifier on your attack roll due to Devising a Stratagem

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-NNwBapZCWVZIzptNewN_feat_class_special
attribs.current: This is a free action If you're aware that your target is the subject of a lead you're pursuing

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NUZp17ZmydaS94Bws8S_description
attribs.current:
Water blasts upward, coming out of the ground, rising from a pool, or even manifesting from thin air. Any creatures in the area take bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier, with a basic Reflex saving throw.

You can change this spell's area to a 5-foot burst, provided you center the burst in a body of water. This body of water can be as small as a pond or creek, but not as small as a puddle or bathtub.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NUZop5dZcnxuKLgBljy_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target takes double damage and takes a 10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round.

abilities.name: Treat-Wounds
